Abstract
Travel planning is often a time-intensive and complex process that requires
Planner , an innovative solution that simplifies and personalizes the entire travel
Key Features of the Application
Our application streamlines travel planning by taking only four essential inputs
1. Destination : The traveler's desired location.
2. Number of Days : The duration of the trip.
3. Budget : The financial limit for the entire journey.
4. Number of Travelers : To tailor recommendations appropriately.
Using these inputs, the system generates a comprehensive itinerary that includes:
Accommodation Recommendations : Suggestions for hotels, hostels, or
Time-to-Time Schedule : A structured day-to-day plan covering:
Meals : Where to have breakfast, lunch, and dinner, featuring local
Activities : Famous activities and experiences unique to the
Local Delicacies : Recommendations for iconic foods to try,
Must-Visit Places : Highlights of the destination, including

2.1 Introduction

2.2 Functional Requirements
The functional requirements define the core functionalities of the application,
Input Handling: Accept user inputs for destination, budget, travel days, and
Itinerary Generation: Generate a detailed day-to-day itinerary tailored to the
Recommendations: Provide personalized suggestions for accommodations,
Real-Time Adjustments: Adapt recommendations based on live data such
User Interaction: Allow users to view, edit, and save itineraries.
2.3 Data Requirements
The system relies on extensive datasets to generate accurate and relevant
Accommodation Data: Information on hotels, hostels, and alternative stays
Attractions and Activities: Data on popular destinations, cultural
Culinary Information: Details of local restaurants, cafes, and must-try
Geographic Data: Maps and transportation details for planning routes and
2.4 Performance Requirements
Speed: Itineraries should be generated within 5 seconds.
Scalability: The system must support a high volume of concurrent users.
Accessibility: The app should load efficiently across devices and internet

4.1 Introduction
Implementation involves the translation of the system design into functional code

Styling : Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, and Shadcn/UI for modern, responsive
4.3 Coding Standards

Conclusion, Limitation & Future Scope
6.1 Conclusion
The AI-based Travel Itinerary Planner successfully streamlines the travel planning
6.2 Limitations
Limited to destinations with sufficient data.
Internet dependency for data retrieval and AI functionality.
6.3 Future Scope
Integration with booking platforms for seamless reservations.
Support for offline itinerary viewing.
Addition of transportation planning modules.
